metadata.ttm:title: Basic Information
metadata.ttm:desc: In the Basic Information Template, the actual Clauses you use may vary depending on both your Standard Responses and the Schedule to which you are submitting your Offer.

div.p: Your Solicitation Clauses' Basic Information screen
may ask different or fewer questions than this
example, as different solicitations require
different clause responses.
This video provides an example of several
questions you may see while completing this
section.
Begin by noting the small yellow question marks next
to the topic headings.
By clicking any of the question marks, you can
obtain copies of the actual clause details in
full text.
Also, should you respond "Yes" to any of the
questions, you should download, complete, and
save a copy of the form.
The first question is applicable to you if your
company is working with third party dealers to
resell products and if those dealers are
participating with you on this contract.
Answer according to your situation.
In the "Delivery Prices" textbox, identify the
foreign countries in which you are proposing to do
business.
If you are proposing that your services are only to
be performed domestically, or you do not intend to
ship products abroad, simply enter "N-A."
Identify whether there are Hazardous Materials that
will be shipped under this contract.
Hazardous materials, as defined by GSA, include
carcinogenic chemicals, toxins, corrosives,
combustible liquids, or generally any item which,
while being transported or moved, is a risk to public
safety or an environmental hazard.
This list is governed by the Federal Standard
Number 313.
You should consult this document if you have any
questions about the products you're shipping.
The "Fire or Casualty, Hazards, or Safety or
Health Requirements" section requires you to
indicate if there are safety standards
associated with any of the products you are shipping.
"C-FSS-411" identifies some of the products that
may require such standards, even including
items such as electrical equipment.
If any of your items are subject to these
standards, you will need to furnish proof that the
standards have been met The EPA requires that
certain products be registered with its agency
before being distributed.
This can include agricultural products,
biochemical products, insect repellant, and even
some basic home and garden items.
"Performance Oriented Packaging", in essence,
asks if there is an additional charge for the
shipping of any potentially hazardous
materials.
The "Within Consignee's Premises" question asks
you whether you are going to charge an additional
fee for delivery of your product inside the buyer's
office, warehouse, etc. Though applicable to other
products, the easiest way to think of this is with
furniture deliveries.
A furniture vendor would answer "Yes" if she were
going to charge an additional fee and not
only deliver a desk to the buying agency's doorstep
but take the desk inside and place it where
directed.
We are going to select "No" for this example, but
as a reminder, if do select Yes, you need to
download and complete the form by clicking the
yellow question mark.
For the "Delivery Prices" question, indicate whether
you are going to allow FOB shipping to Alaska,
Hawaii, or Puerto Rico If you do not check the
boxes, standard shipping will cover transporting
your goods to the point of export nearest to the
designated destination.
For example, goods shipped to Puerto Rico may be
transported through Miami.
The ordering agency will then be responsible for
transportation costs associated with shipping
the goods from Miami to their office in Puerto
Rico.
Click the "Add Basic Information" button when
you have responded to all of the questions.
